title: 115_s3555
content: The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" is the short title of this legislation, which includes definitions for various terms. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" includes definitions for terms such as 'LGBT' and 'older LGBT individual' within the Older Americans Act of 1965. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy within the Administration, headed by a Director appointed by the Secretary to coordinate activities for improved services for older individuals. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy within the Administration to advocate for older LGBT individuals at the federal and state levels. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy to support research, collect information on challenges faced by older LGBT individuals, especially those in rural areas and living with HIV/AIDS. The "Elder Pride Act of 2018" establishes the Office of Older LGBT Policy to recommend policies, prioritize care, and administer grants for older LGBT individuals, including those in rural areas and living with HIV/AIDS. The Director must submit reports to Congress periodically. The Director must submit a report to Congress by January 31 of fiscal year 2023 and every fifth fiscal year thereafter, detailing activities conducted under this subsection in the previous 5 fiscal years. SEC. 423. RURAL OUTREACH GRANT PROGRAM is added to Part A of title IV of the Older Americans Act of 1965, providing for a new grant program. The section defines the terms 'Director' and 'eligible entity' for the Office of Older LGBT Policy. An eligible entity can be a State or an organization focusing on serving older or LGBT individuals. The purpose of this section is to provide resources and incentives for connecting with older LGBT individuals in rural areas. The Director may grant funds to eligible entities for this purpose. The Director may grant funds to eligible entities for activities in rural areas meeting the needs of individuals. Grants are made in accordance with specified requirements and applications must be submitted containing necessary information. An application for a grant under this section must include a description of proposed activities, the population in a rural area served, resources available, and intent to partner with local organizations. The application for a grant under this section must include a description of proposed activities, population served in rural areas, available resources, intent to partner with local organizations, evidence of meeting urgent needs, and any other necessary information determined by the Director. The grant under this section is for approved activities aimed at creating partnerships between older LGBT individuals in rural areas and the eligible entity. Approved activities may include education and training for community outreach to this population. The grant aims to engage in education and training for community outreach to older LGBT individuals in rural areas, reduce isolation, improve access to care, build relationships between individuals and the local community, foster relationships with service providers, and improve LGBT cultural competency among organizations and personnel providing services. The Director will establish standards and guidelines for approved activities supported by a grant to improve LGBT cultural competency among organizations and personnel providing services to older individuals in rural areas and expand non-discrimination policies protecting sexual orientation and gender identity. The Director will establish standards and guidelines for approved activities supported by a grant to improve LGBT cultural competency among organizations and personnel providing services to older individuals in rural areas. Eligible entities receiving a grant must cooperate and coordinate with local entities in carrying out approved activities. Eligible entities receiving a grant under this section must cooperate and coordinate with state and local agencies, as well as public and private organizations providing services to older LGBT individuals in the area served by the activities. Eligible entities receiving grants must prioritize cooperation with organizations serving economically underserved populations. The Director must submit reports on activities every two fiscal years.
